body:
**Actionable comments posted: 6** > [!CAUTION] > Some comments are outside the diff and can‚Äôt be posted inline due to platform limitations. > > > >
> ‚ö†Ô∏è Outside diff range comments (1)
> >
> opc/scripts/setup/wizard.py (1)
> > `713-733`: **Consider extracting common symlink installation logic to reduce duplication.** > > The symlink installation handling is duplicated between the "existing config" flow (lines 713-733) and the "clean install" flow (lines 771-791). Both blocks: > 1. Call `install_opc_integration_symlink` > 2. Report symlinked/backed-up dirs > 3. Build TypeScript hooks > 4. Handle errors > > >
> Proposed refactor: Extract helper function > > ```python > def _run_symlink_install(claude_dir: Path, opc_source: Path) -> bool: > """Run symlink installation and report results. Returns success status.""" > result = install_opc_integration_symlink(claude_dir, opc_source) > > if result["success"]: > console.print(f" [green]OK[/green] Symlinked: {', '.join(result['symlinked_dirs'])}") > if result["backed_up_dirs"]: > console.print(f" [green]OK[/green] Backed up: {', '.join(result['backed_up_dirs'])}") > console.print(" [dim]Changes in ~/.claude/ now sync to repo automatically[/dim]") > > # Build TypeScript hooks > console.print(" Building TypeScript hooks...") > hooks_dir = claude_dir / "hooks" > build_success, build_msg = build_typescript_hooks(hooks_dir) > if build_success: > console.print(f" [green]OK[/green] {build_msg}") > else: > console.print(f" [yellow]WARN[/yellow] {build_msg}") > console.print(" [dim]You can build manually: cd ~/.claude/hooks && npm install && npm run build[/dim]") > return True > else: > console.print(f" [red]ERROR[/red] {result.get('error', 'Unknown error')}") > return False > ``` > > Then use in both places: > ```python > elif choice == "3": # or choice == "2" in clean install > _run_symlink_install(claude_dir, opc_source) > ``` >
> > > Also applies to: 771-791 > >
> >
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ```` In @opc/scripts/setup/claude_integration.py: - Line 600: Move the local "import os" out of the function and add it with the other module-level imports at the top of the file, then remove the in-function "import os" so the module uses the top-level import instead. - Around line 657-678: The symlink install in claude_integration.py is missing the same root scripts copy done by install_opc_integration; add code that copies the individual root scripts (e.g. ast_grep_find.py, qlty_check.py and the other files copied in the regular install) from opc_source.parent / "opc" / "scripts" into target_dir / "scripts" (create the parent dir if needed, remove any existing target files before copying, and preserve permissions), using the existing opc_source and target_dir variables so skills/hooks that reference those root scripts can find them. - Around line 616-618: The current code creates backup_dir (variable) unconditionally which leaves empty timestamped folders when nothing is backed up; change the flow in the backup routine so you first scan target_dir for actual items to back up (skip symlinks and non-existent entries), and only call backup_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) and proceed with copying when that scan finds at least one real item; update any logic in the same function that references backup_dir to be inside the conditional that runs after creation so no empty backup directories are ever created. - Around line 637-639: Wrap the os.symlink(source_path, target_path) call in a try/except that catches OSError, and when platform.system() == "Windows" set a clear actionable message on result["error"] (e.g. instruct enabling Developer Mode or running as Administrator, include the original exception text) and return result; otherwise re-raise the exception; preserve appending dir_name to result["symlinked_dirs"] only on successful symlink creation. In @README.md: - Around line 992-995: The fenced ASCII diagram block lacks a language specifier; update the triple-backtick fence surrounding the diagram (the block containing "continuous-claude/.claude/ ‚îÄ‚îÄCOPY‚îÄ‚îÄ> ~/.claude/") to include a specifier such as text (e.g., change ``` to ```text) so the README's diagram renders consistently and satisfies the linter. - Around line 1004-1008: The fenced ASCII diagram block in README.md is missing a language specifier; update the three-backtick fence that wraps the "~/.claude/..." symlink diagram to include a language (e.g., "text") so the linter recognizes it‚Äîlocate the fenced block (the ASCII diagram showing ~/.claude/rules, ~/.claude/skills, ~/.claude/hooks, ~/.claude/agents) and change the opening ``` to ```text. ````
üìú Review details **Configuration used**: Organization UI **Review profile**: ASSERTIVE **Plan**: Pro **Knowledge base: Disabled due to `Reviews -> Disable Knowledge Base` setting**
üì• Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between c52cdcc6689e6d77606c5eb94af4358d4a9cdf09 and 2b9ede452c0bd301accf3ea6ff141990eef0106a.
üìí Files selected for processing (3) * `README.md` * `opc/scripts/setup/claude_integration.py` * `opc/scripts/setup/wizard.py`
üß∞ Additional context used
üß¨ Code graph analysis (1)
opc/scripts/setup/wizard.py (1)
opc/scripts/setup/claude_integration.py (3) * `install_opc_integration_symlink` (581-685) * `backup_claude_dir` (229-248) * `get_opc_integration_source` (130-141)
ü™õ markdownlint-cli2 (0.18.1)
README.md 992-992: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified (MD040, fenced-code-language) --- 1004-1004: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified (MD040, fenced-code-language)
üîá Additional comments (6)
README.md (1)
`979-1041`: **Documentation is clear and comprehensive.** The new "Installation Mode: Copy vs Symlink" section accurately documents: - Differences between copy and symlink modes - Pros/cons of each approach - Manual switching instructions with verification The symlink directories (rules, skills, hooks, agents) match what's implemented in `install_opc_integration_symlink()`.
opc/scripts/setup/claude_integration.py (1)
`581-685`: **Function structure and approach are sound.** The symlink installation mode correctly: - Symlinks the four key directories (rules, skills, hooks, agents) - Copies settings.json separately (allowing user customization) - Backs up existing non-symlink directories before replacing - Handles existing symlinks by unlinking first The return type accurately documents `backed_up_dirs` in both the result dict and the usage in wizard.py.
opc/scripts/setup/wizard.py (4)
`634-634`: **Import correctly added.** The `install_opc_integration_symlink` import is properly added alongside other imports from `claude_integration`. --- `665-673`: **Clear and informative installation options.** The updated UI effectively communicates: - Three options for existing config (Full/Fresh/Symlink/Skip) - Visual highlighting with `[cyan]` for the symlink option - Explanatory notes about symlink behavior The descriptions align well with contributor workflows. --- `702-733`: **TypeScript hooks build is correctly integrated for symlink path.** After symlink installation succeeds, the TypeScript hooks are built, matching the behavior of the copy installation path. This ensures hooks work regardless of installation mode. --- `737-746`: **Clean install flow properly updated with symlink option.** The clean install path now offers: 1. Copy install (default) 2. Symlink install 3. Skip This mirrors the existing config flow appropriately, with clear messaging about the benefits of symlink mode for contributors.

**Actionable comments posted: 2**
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In @opc/scripts/setup/claude_integration.py: - Around line 667-707: The duplicated script-copying logic in claude_integration.py (in the block that copies "core", "math", "tldr" and the root_scripts list) is the same as the one in install_opc_integration; extract a shared helper (e.g., _copy_scripts(opc_source: Path, target_dir: Path) -> int) to perform the directory copies and individual root script copies, return a count if needed, and replace the duplicated blocks in both install_opc_integration and the code that currently lives in claude_integration.py to call this helper (referencing the root_scripts list and the same src/dst construction inside the helper). In @README.md: - Around line 1020-1041: Add a Windows-specific note under the "Switching to Symlink Mode" section after the verification step explaining how to create directory symlinks on Windows (mention both mklink /D for Command Prompt and New-Item -ItemType SymbolicLink for PowerShell), instruct to run as Administrator or enable Developer Mode, show example variable use for $REPO and $HOME with backslash paths, and remind users about elevated privileges required; reference the section heading "Switching to Symlink Mode" and the commands mklink and New-Item so the maintainer can place the Windows note in the same block. ```
üìú Review details **Configuration used**: Organization UI **Review profile**: ASSERTIVE **Plan**: Pro **Knowledge base: Disabled due to `Reviews -> Disable Knowledge Base` setting**

üìí Files selected for processing (2) * `README.md` * `opc/scripts/setup/claude_integration.py`
üß∞ Additional context used
ü™õ Ruff (0.14.10)
opc/scripts/setup/claude_integration.py 642-642: Local variable `e` is assigned to but never used Remove assignment to unused variable `e` (F841)
üîá Additional comments (6)
opc/scripts/setup/claude_integration.py (3)
`582-606`: **LGTM! Clean function signature and result structure.** The function signature is well-documented with clear docstring explaining the purpose and return type. The result dictionary structure with `success`, `symlinked_dirs`, `backed_up_dirs`, and `error` keys provides good feedback for the wizard UI. --- `608-650`: **Solid symlink creation logic with proper Windows handling.** The implementation correctly: - Creates backup directory lazily (only when backups are actually needed) - Backs up existing directories before replacing with symlinks - Removes stale symlinks before creating new ones - Provides actionable Windows-specific guidance when symlinks fail Note: The static analysis warning about unused variable `e` on line 642 is a false positive‚Äî`e` is correctly used in the error message on line 646. --- `709-714`: **LGTM!** Error handling is consistent with the existing `install_opc_integration` function. Success is correctly set only after all operations complete.
README.md (3)
`979-987`: **Clear and helpful comparison table.** The table concisely explains when to use each mode. The distinction between "End users, stable setup" vs "Contributors, development" provides good guidance for user selection. --- `988-999`: **LGTM!** Clear explanation of copy mode behavior with accurate pros/cons. --- `1000-1019`: **LGTM!** The documented symlinked directories (rules, skills, hooks, agents) correctly match the implementation in `install_opc_integration_symlink`. Pros and cons accurately represent the tradeoffs.

**Actionable comments posted: 2**
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In @README.md: - Around line 1020-1042: Add an explicit verification step after the backup and before the destructive rm -rf: instruct users to list and inspect the backup directory (e.g., ls -la ~/.claude/backups/$(date +%Y%m%d) and optionally check contents of rules, skills, hooks, agents or run du -sh on the backup folder) and only proceed to run rm -rf ~/.claude/{rules,skills,hooks,agents} once they confirm the files exist and look correct. - Around line 1043-1066: Add an explicit backup verification step after creating $BackupDir and running Copy-Item to ensure the expected directories/files were successfully copied; use PowerShell checks (e.g., Test-Path or Get-ChildItem against $BackupDir and check the presence/count of "$BackupDir\rules", "$BackupDir\skills", "$BackupDir\hooks", "$BackupDir\agents") and log or throw an error if any expected item is missing before proceeding to Remove-Item and symlink creation. ```

üîá Additional comments (3)
README.md (3)
`979-987`: **LGTM! Clear documentation structure.** The section introduction and comparison table effectively communicate the two installation modes and their use cases. --- `988-999`: **LGTM! Copy mode documentation is clear.** The explanation, diagram, and trade-offs are well-articulated for users choosing the default installation mode. --- `1000-1019`: **LGTM! Symlink mode benefits and trade-offs are well-explained.** The documentation clearly articulates why contributors would prefer symlink mode and provides appropriate warnings about the trade-offs.

**Actionable comments posted: 1**
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In `@opc/scripts/setup/claude_integration.py`: - Line 411: The for-loop defining subdirectories is syntactically malformed and causes a SyntaxError at import; in the loop that iterates over subdir (used by install_opc_integration and install_opc_integration_symlink), replace the broken literal ["core", "math", "tldr, "mcp" "] with a properly quoted, comma-separated list (e.g., ["core", "math", "tldr", "mcp"]) so the module can import and the functions can run. ```
üßπ Nitpick comments (1)
opc/scripts/setup/wizard.py (1)
`783-837`: **Clean install symlink option works correctly.** The symlink path for clean installs correctly: - Calls `install_opc_integration_symlink` - Reports symlinked directories (no backed_up_dirs expected) - Builds TypeScript hooks Minor observation: The TypeScript build block appears in multiple branches. Consider extracting to a helper in a follow-up if more install modes are added.

‚è∞ Context from checks skipped due to timeout of 90000ms. You can increase the timeout in your CodeRabbit configuration to a maximum of 15 minutes (900000ms). (1) * GitHub Check: Cursor Bugbot
üîá Additional comments (5)
opc/scripts/setup/claude_integration.py (2)
`383-431`: **Good refactoring: Shared helper eliminates duplication.** The extraction of `ROOT_SCRIPTS` constant and `_copy_scripts()` helper centralizes script-copying logic, making future maintenance easier. Both install paths now share identical behavior for scripts. Note: Fix the syntax error on line 411 (flagged separately) before merging. --- `585-678`: **LGTM: Symlink installation with proper safeguards.** The function handles key edge cases well: - Lazy backup directory creation (only when needed) - Windows-specific error messaging with Developer Mode guidance - Graceful handling of existing symlinks vs. real directories - Delegates script copying to shared helper
opc/scripts/setup/wizard.py (3)
`680-681`: **LGTM: Import aligns with new public API.** The import of `install_opc_integration_symlink` correctly references the new function from `claude_integration.py`. --- `710-719`: **Clear menu presentation for installation options.** The expanded menu with symlink explanation helps users make an informed choice. The dim text describing auto-sync behavior is a nice touch for contributor UX. --- `759-779`: **Symlink flow correctly integrated with existing config handling.** The flow: 1. Calls `install_opc_integration_symlink` 2. Reports symlinked/backed-up directories 3. Builds TypeScript hooks 4. Handles errors gracefully Matches the copy install pattern appropriately.
‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can disable this entire section by setting `review_details` to `false` in your review settings.
